        public static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode>> getCatIDsFoundNodesMap(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode rootOfCategoryTree,
                                                                                                                                            java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> catIDNameDictionary)
        Return a map containing (catid, list of nodes from hierarchy tree which contains that cat id)

        created to improve performance by reducing redundant computations

        if a catid exists in cat id name dictionary but does not exists in hierrchy tree then the list if of size o.

        Returns:

      • recursiveDfs

        public static boolean recursiveDfs(javafx.scene.control.TreeItem<java.lang.String> node,
                                   java.lang.String valueToSearch)
        Performs a depth-first search, starting from the given node, for any node that satisfies the condition isGoal(node), and prints the path from the goal back to the root.

        ref:https://www.cis.upenn.edu/~matuszek/cit594-2003/Examples/TreeTraversals/TreeTraversals.java

        Parameters:
        root - The root of the tree or subtree to be searched.
        Returns:
        True if a goal node could be found.

      • recursiveDfs

        public static boolean recursiveDfs(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode node,
                                   java.lang.String valueToSearch,
                                   int depth)
        Performs a depth-first search, starting from the given node, for any node that satisfies the condition isGoal(node), and prints the path from the goal back to the root.

        ref:https://www.cis.upenn.edu/~matuszek/cit594-2003/Examples/TreeTraversals/TreeTraversals.java

        Parameters:
        root - The root of the tree or subtree to be searched.
        Returns:
        True if a goal node could be found.

      • recursiveDfsMultipleOccurences

        public static boolean recursiveDfsMultipleOccurences(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode node,
                                                     java.lang.String valueToSearch)
        Use depth-first-search recursively to find if the valueToSearch is present in the tree with node as root. If value is found, print the level and path at which the goal node is found.
        Parameters:
        node -
        valueToSearch -
        Returns:

      • convertTreeItemsToTreeNodes

        public static javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode convertTreeItemsToTreeNodes(javafx.scene.control.TreeItem<java.lang.String> oldNode)
        Convert a tree of javafx.scene.control.TreeItem(s) to a tree of javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode(s). A primary motivation for this could be that TreeNode is serializable (though not thread safe) while TreeItem is not serializable.

        ref:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16098362/how-to-deep-copy-a-tree

        Parameters:
        root -

      • treeToString

        public static java.lang.String treeToString(int depth,
                                            javafx.scene.control.TreeItem<java.lang.String> node,
                                            java.lang.StringBuffer str)
        Return a string representation of the tree of TreeItem nodes.

        Each line represents a node as shown below.

        depth0:TreeItem [ value: -1:root ]

        \tdepth1:TreeItem [ value: 934:Community ]

        \t\tdepth2:TreeItem [ value: 133:Campus Spot ]

        \t\t\tdepth3:TreeItem [ value: 135:Administration ]

        \t\t\tdepth3:TreeItem [ value: 138:Campus Commons ]

        \t\t\tdepth3:TreeItem [ value: 153:Campus - Other ]

        Parameters:
        depth -
        node -
        str -
        Returns:

      • stringToTree

        public static javafx.scene.control.TreeItem stringToTree(java.util.List<java.lang.String> stringTree)
        INCOMPLETE

        Construct a tree of TreeItems from a file containing the string tree produced by UIUtilityBox.treeToString()

        Expecting each line to represent a node as shown below.

        depth0:TreeItem [ value: -1:root ]

        \tdepth1:TreeItem [ value: 934:Community ]

        \t\tdepth2:TreeItem [ value: 133:Campus Spot ]

        \t\t\tdepth3:TreeItem [ value: 135:Administration ]

        \t\t\tdepth3:TreeItem [ value: 138:Campus Commons ]

        \t\t\tdepth3:TreeItem [ value: 153:Campus - Other ]

        Parameters:
        stringTree -
        Returns:
